metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8808 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The DecodeImage function in coders/gif.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.18 allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access)via a crafted GIF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8808` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1build1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1build1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1build1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1build1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1build1').
